headline.main: Saudi Women And the Right To Play Sports

docs.abstract: Saudi Arabia is grappling with rules that prevent women from exercising after Saudi woman Dalma Malhas wins medal in horse jumping at Youth Olympic Games; photos (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: After the 18-year-old Saudi equestrian Dalma Malhas won a bronze medal in show jumping at the first Youth Olympic Games in Singapore in August, she was singled out for praise by Jacques Rogge, chairman of the International Olympic Committee, in a news conference at the Games' conclusion. ''This is indeed the first time that a Saudi woman is participating in an international event,'' let alone winning a medal, Mr. Rogge said of Olympic events. Ms. Malhas's achievement, he said, had made the I.O.C. ''absolutely happy.''

headline.seo: For Saudi Women, Biggest Challenge Is Getting to Play
headline.print_headline:
Saudi Women
And the Right
To Play Sports
headline.main: For Saudi Women, Biggest Challenge Is Getting to Play

docs.lead_paragraph: Physical activity is forbidden in Saudi Arabia’s state-run girls’ schools, and the country is one of the few that have not sent women to the Olympic Games.
docs.snippet: Physical activity is forbidden in Saudi Arabia’s state-run girls’ schools, and the country is one of the few that have not sent women to the Olympic Games.

headline.seo: Cathleen P. Black on Coke Board During Soda Wars
headline.print_headline: As Bloomberg Fought Sodas, Nominee Sat On Coke Board
headline.main: As Bloomberg Fought Sodas, Nominee Sat on Coke Board

byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and ANEMONA HARTOCOLLIS

docs.lead_paragraph: Cathleen P. Black, the mayor’s schools chancellor pick, was a board member when Coca-Cola aggressively attacked efforts to rid schools of sugary drinks.
docs.snippet: Cathleen P. Black, the mayor’s schools chancellor pick, was a board member when Coca-Cola aggressively attacked efforts to rid schools of sugary drinks.

headline.main: Taxing Soda to Close the Deficit

docs.abstract: The second bipartisan panel to issue a big deficit report has come out in favor of a tax on soda and other sweetened beverages.

headline.seo: Does Drinking Water Before Meals Aid Weight Loss?
headline.print_headline: THE CLAIM: Drinking water before meals aids weight loss.
headline.main: The Claim: Drinking Water Before Meals Aids Weight Loss

docs.lead_paragraph: Water fills the stomach, thus reducing hunger. Dieters have been encouraged to employ this trick for ages, but only in recent years have studies borne this out.
docs.snippet: Water fills the stomach, thus reducing hunger. Dieters have been encouraged to employ this trick for ages, but only in recent years have studies borne this out.
